gobblin.runtime.app

Class ServiceBasedAppLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.runtime.app.ServiceBasedAppLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApplicationLauncher, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SchedulerDaemon

    @Alpha
public class ServiceBasedAppLauncher
extends Object
implements ApplicationLauncher
    An implementation of ApplicationLauncher that defines an application as a set of Services that should be started and stopped. The class will run a set of core services, some of which are optional, some of which are mandatory. These Services are as follows:
    • MetricsReportingService is optional and controlled by ConfigurationKeys.METRICS_ENABLED_KEY
    • JobExecutionInfoServer is optional and controlled by ConfigurationKeys.JOB_EXECINFO_SERVER_ENABLED_KEY
    • AdminWebServer is optional and controlled by ConfigurationKeys.ADMIN_SERVER_ENABLED_KEY
    • JMXReportingService is mandatory

    Additional Services can be added via the addService(Service) method. A Service cannot be added after the application has started. Additional Services can also be specified via the configuration key APP_ADDITIONAL_SERVICES.

    An ServiceBasedAppLauncher cannot be restarted.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String APP_ADDITIONAL_SERVICES
      A comma separated list of fully qualified classes that implement the Service interface.
      static String APP_NAME
      The name of the application.
      static String APP_STOP_TIME_SECONDS
      The number of seconds to wait for the application to stop, the default value is DEFAULT_APP_STOP_TIME_SECONDS

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the ApplicationLauncher by starting all associated services. This method also adds a shutdown hook that invokes stop() and the close() methods. So stop() and close() need not be called explicitly; they can be triggered during the JVM shutdown.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ApplicationLauncher

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws ApplicationException
        Stops the ApplicationLauncher by stopping all associated services.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ApplicationLauncher
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if there is any problem starting the application

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addService

        public void addService(Service service)
        Add a Service to be run by this ApplicationLauncher.

        This method is public because there are certain classes launchers (such as Azkaban) that require the ApplicationLauncher to extend a pre-defined class. Since Java classes cannot extend multiple classes, composition needs to be used. In which case this method needs to be public.
